qas.question: How far away was the plant located from the epicenter?
How many troops were allocated to Zipingpu?
What power plant was damaged by the earthquake?
How near to the epicenter was the power plant?
What has a recent inspection found about the damage to the power plant?
What might possibly collapse upstream from the power plant?
What is the total number of dams damaged?

context: The <a4_0>Zipingpu <a0_0>Hydropower Plant<a4_0/><a0_0/> (simplified Chinese: 紫坪铺水库; traditional Chinese: 紫坪鋪水庫) located <a1_0><a5_0>20 km<a5_0/> east<a1_0/> of the epicenter was damaged. A recent inspection indicated that the damage was <a6_0>less severe<a6_0/> than initially feared, and it remains structurally stable and safe. The <a7_0>Tulong reservoir<a7_0/> upstream is in danger of collapse. About <a2_0>2,000<a2_0/> troops have been allocated to Zipingpu, trying to release the pressure through spillway. In total, <a3_0><a8_0>391<a8_0/><a3_0/> dams, most of them small, were reported damaged by the quake.
